decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the game through counter spells, board wipes, and card advantage. The deck utilizes a combination of counterspells like Force of Will and Counterspell, along with removal like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder help to find key cards while Sensei's Divining Top and Counterbalance provide additional control over the top of the deck. The win condition comes from powerful threats like Monastery Mentor and Snapcaster Mage.

This UWx Control deck focuses on using Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to control the opponent's plays. With a wide range of counter spells like Force of Will and Pyroblast, as well as removal like Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent. Dig Through Time and Brainstorm provide card advantage and selection, while win conditions like Entreat the Angels and Jace, the Mind Sculptor help close out the game. Terminus serves as a board wipe option, while cards like Vendilion Clique and Snapcaster Mage provide additional utility and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing the infect mechanic to win the game quickly by dealing 10 poison counters to the opponent. It aims to play efficient creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, while protecting them with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The deck also includes pump spells like Berserk and Become Immense to quickly increase the power of its creatures. By combining aggressive creatures with protection and pump spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can effectively respond.

The deck focuses on using a combination of land destruction, hand disruption, and efficient creatures to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It utilizes cards like Wasteland, Liliana of the Veil, and Punishing Fire to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through Dark Confidant and Sylvan Library. The deck also has access to powerful tutor effects like Green Sun's Zenith to find key creatures like Knight of the Reliquary. By controlling the game and outvaluing the opponent, the deck aims to grind out a win in the long game.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, while controlling the game with counter spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. It also uses disruptive cards like Abrupt Decay and Wasteland to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck's goal is to apply early pressure and maintain control of the game through a combination of efficient threats and disruption spells, allowing it to quickly close out games before opponents can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressively with a combination of efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Deathrite Shaman, while disrupting opponents with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes powerful card selection and draw spells like Brainstorm and Dig Through Time to ensure consistent threats and answers. The mana base is designed to provide access to all necessary colors while also running Wasteland to disrupt opposing lands. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also assembling a powerful combo with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to bring out a 20/20 Marit Lage token. With cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base while generating card advantage and recurring lands with Life from the Loam. The deck also includes methods to draw extra cards and ramp up mana with Mox Diamond and Exploration. Overall, the key strategy is to control the game through powerful land interactions and win with the Dark Depths combo.

This deck is a control deck with a focus on disruption and resource denial. It aims to control the game through cards like Liliana of the Veil, Dark Confidant, and Chalice of the Void. It also has a strong land-based strategy, using cards like Knight of the Reliquary, Green Sun's Zenith, and Life from the Loam to search for key lands and generate card advantage. The deck also has options for life gain and removal with cards like Punishing Fire and Abrupt Decay. The main strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually gaining control of the game.

This deck focuses on early aggression and disruption to control the pace of the game. By utilizing powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets, along with efficient removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Toxic Deluge, the deck aims to quickly pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach. With a strong mana base and access to powerful blue spells like Force of Will and Brainstorm, this deck is versatile and adaptable, able to handle a variety of opposing strategies.

The deck is focused on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf while disrupting the opponent's resources with cards like Wasteland, Stifle, and Daze. The deck aims to control the game by countering opponent's spells with Force of Will and disrupting their mana base, while also dealing damage efficiently with cards like Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt. The deck utilizes card selection and manipulation with Ponder and Brainstorm to maintain a consistent game plan and maximize efficiency.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the pieces needed to play an "Omniscience" or "Show and Tell" card, in order to put a powerful creature like "Emrakul, the Aeons Torn" into play for free. The deck includes various ways to dig through the library for key cards, as well as counter spells and protection to ensure the combo can be successfully executed. This combo-heavy strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent with a game-ending creature in just a few turns, taking advantage of the Legacy format's powerful card pool.

The deck focuses on utilizing Show and Tell to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield for free. It includes ways to protect the combo with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, as well as card draw and selection with Brainstorm and Dig Through Time. Boseiju, Who Shelters All is included to make sure key spells resolve. Cunning Wish allows for flexibility in finding answers from the sideboard. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with massive threats.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly in order to cast multiple spells in a single turn and win the game with a high storm count. It includes a variety of cheap cantrips to dig for combo pieces, along with hand disruption spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The main win condition is either Empty the Warrens for a swarm of goblins or Tendrils of Agony to drain the opponent's life total. The deck aims to be resilient against disruption attempts and able to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly using cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, while using efficient black spells like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual to play multiple spells in a turn. By digging deep into the deck with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain, the player aims to find their win condition - either Ad Nauseam or Tendrils of Agony - to finish off the opponent in one explosive turn. Additionally, cards like Gitaxian Probe, Cabal Therapy, and Duress are used to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect the combo.

This combo deck focuses on generating a high storm count to cast powerful spells like Tendrils of Agony or Empty the Warrens to win the game. The deck includes a lot of cantrips, rituals, and tutors to quickly cycle through the deck and find the necessary pieces to go off. Using cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Past in Flames to generate mana and flash back spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a storm of spells in a single turn to secure the victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells, manipulating the top of the library with Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top, and using powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. It also includes card draw and manipulation with Brainstorm, Dig Through Time, and Ponder, as well as board wipes with Terminus. The win condition is through casting powerful angels with Entreat the Angels, and using versatile creatures like Vendilion Clique and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to maintain card advantage and control the board. The deck aims to outlast opponents and win through attrition.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small, aggressive creatures such as Delver of Secrets, Monastery Swiftspear, and Young Pyromancer. This is supported by a suite of cheap disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Cabal Therapy to protect and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and filtering spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Dig Through Time to ensure consistent and efficient draw options. The deck also leverages burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt for additional reach and removal.

This deck revolves around leveraging the power of Merfolk creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, as well as disruptive cards like True-Name Nemesis and Vendilion Clique, the goal is to establish a fast and efficient board presence. With support from cards like Aether Vial and Force of Will for protection, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and maintain control of the game tempo.
